metadata.Title: CVE-2021-35266 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In NTFS-3G versions < 2021.8.22, when a specially crafted NTFS inode pathname is supplied in an NTFS image a heap buffer overflow can occur resulting in memory disclosure, denial of service and even code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libntfs-3g883 - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu1.1
ntfs-3g - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu1.1').
